page.title: 02CULWORTH VILLAGE
page.content: Most of the old houses in Culworth are built of local stone obtained from nearby quarries of sandstone,limestone, and ironstone.There is also Byfield blackstone used for flooring.There are thirty dwellings dating from C17 & C18. More recently seventeen new houses have been built during the second half of the twentieth century. One cottage called Old Walls is the only building to still have a thatched roof.One house is in the process of being built by its owner Mr Kilmister,a Banbury policeman. There are twenty six buildings listed as being of historic interest in the village plus headstones and memorials in the churchyard. Also listed is Culworth Mill just outside the village,believed to stand on the site of the mill mentioned in the original Domesday Book.
